component.text: Hard disk drives are the main storage medium found in almost all computers including: servers, desktops and laptops. Hard drives are typically internal components attached to the motherboard. However, external hard drives can be connected to the computer via a USB or hard disk controller card. As the size of the hard disk drive increases, so does the price.

Floppy disks are external storage devices that can store 1.44 MB of data. While some floppy disks are still encountered, they are being replaced by static memory devices which offer higher storage capacities at lower prices.
Tape drives are storage devices used to backup information for archival or disaster recovery purposes. They are typically encountered only in the server environment.
